definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

sentences.english: Say “no” to projects and tasks that are not aligned with your yearly and life goals.
sentences.chinese: 拒绝授受与你人生及年度目标不一致的项目和任务。

sentences.english: The verb of the Japanese given relation is very complicated.
sentences.chinese: 日语授受关系的动词用法很复杂。

sentences.english: The station he giving the investigation, said he had nothing to do with data.
sentences.chinese: 警局里安哥授受调查，说资料与他无关。

sentences.english: The notion of teaching with impartation -acceptance as its main method holds the primary place of university teaching activity.
sentences.chinese: 以授受为主的教学观仍然居于大学教学活动的首位。

sentences.english: Giving-and-receiving style is a big difficult point for most of foreign learners.
sentences.chinese: 授受表现对于外语学习者而言是一大难点。

sentences.english: With the transforming from impartation -acceptance to generation and interaction, the notion of teaching of modern university needed immediate reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 从授受走向互动与生成，现代大学教学观亟待重构。

definition: doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
